investigatorQuestion.text: Tell me about your relationship with the victim.

maskAnswers.playerLine: We were business associates. Our interactions were strictly professional and documented.

lowTension.text: Cold. Very cold. No emotion at all about their death?
Professional? Is that why witnesses saw you arguing?
That clinical response is rather disturbing.

highTension.text: I see. And how did you feel when you heard what happened?
Documented, you say. We'll look into that.

maskAnswers.playerLine: They were... they were my friend. I still can't believe they're gone. We had our differences, but I cared about them.

lowTension.text: Friends who had differences. How convenient.
What kind of differences? The violent kind?
Grief can be a great mask for guilt.

highTension.text: I'm sorry for your loss. This must be difficult.
It's clear this affects you. Take a moment if you need.
I understand. Losing someone is never easy.

maskAnswers.playerLine: What are you implying? That I had something to do with this?!

lowTension.text: I'm not implying anything. Your reaction is.
Guilt has a way of making people defensive.
That temper of yours... is that what happened that night?

highTension.text: I'm not accusing you. I'm just gathering information.
Easy. This is standard procedure for everyone.
No implications. Just facts. Tell me about them.

maskAnswers.playerLine: We got along wonderfully. Everyone loved them. I'm sure you'll find only positive things about our relationship.

lowTension.text: No relationship is that perfect. What aren't you telling me?
That sounds rehearsed. Try again with the truth.

highTension.text: All positive? No disagreements at all?
That's nice to hear, but I need specifics.
Good relationships don't mean anything in an investigation.
